original_definition: 'heat generator' means the part of a water heater that generates the heat using one or more of the following processes:combustion of fossil fuels and/or biomass fuels;use of the Joule effect in electric resistance heating elements;capture of ambient heat from an air source, water source or ground source, and/or waste heat;
generated_definition: 'heat generator' means a device that generates heat from various sources, such as electricity or solar energy, and is used to provide hot water or space heating.
